name: Bonnie MacKay
content: Bonnie MacKay Bonnie MacKay Home Research Publications Teaching I am an Instructor at Dalhousie University. Previously I was post-doctorate fellow at Dalhousie University and worked on project that involved Dalhousie, UBC, and OCADU in Canada and SFCar in Brazil. We investigated designing natural user interfaces (NUIs) for a hospital in Brazil. Previously, I worked on two projects with Boeing related to using mobile devices in a hospital and manufacturing setting. I have also worked with the IWK. My primary research field is in Human Computer Interaction with a focus on understanding Web behaviour and issues with mobile devices. Contact Information Office: 323 Faculty of Computer Science Dalhousie University 6050 University Ave. Halifax, NS B3H 1W5 CANADA bmackay[at]cs.dal.ca Education PhD in Computer Science - 2009 (Dalhousie University, Supervisor: Dr. Carolyn Watters) Bachelor of Tourism and Hospitality Management; Faculty of Business Administration (Mount Saint Vincent University) Bachelor of Arts: Political Science (Mount Allison University)
